pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were standing while giving teachings to people who were sitting. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:1.3: “‘I will not give a teaching while walking behind to anyone walking in front who is not sick,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:1.4: One should not give a teaching while walking behind to anyone walking in front who is not sick.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:1.5: If a monk out of disrespect gives a teaching while walking behind to someone walking in front who is not sick, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:1.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk70:1.9: The tenth training rule is finished.
